types.formula: I / you / we / they + main verb (base form); He / she / it + main verb + s/es
types.example: I play tennis; She plays tennis.

types.formula: I / you / we / they + do not (don't) + main verb (base form); He / she / it + does not (doesn't) + main verb (base form)
types.example: I do not play tennis; He doesn't play tennis.

types.formula: Do + I / you / we / they + main verb (base form)?; Does + he / she / it + main verb (base form)?
types.example: Do you play tennis?; Does she play tennis?

types.formula: Do + I / you / we / they + not + main verb (base form)?; Does + he / she / it + not + main verb (base form)?
types.example: Don't you play tennis?; Doesn't he play tennis?

types.formula: I + am + main verb + ing; He / She / It + is + main verb + ing; You / We / They + are + main verb + ing
types.example: I am playing tennis; She is playing tennis; They are playing tennis.

types.formula: I + am not + main verb + ing; He / She / It + is not (isn't) + main verb + ing; You / We / They + are not (aren't) + main verb + ing
types.example: I am not playing tennis; He isn't playing tennis; They aren't playing tennis.

types.formula: Am + I + main verb + ing?; Is + He / She / It + main verb + ing?; Are + You / We / They + main verb + ing?
types.example: Am I playing tennis?; Is she playing tennis?; Are you playing tennis?

types.formula: Am + I + not + main verb + ing?; Is + He / She / It + not + main verb + ing?; Are + You / We / They + not + main verb + ing?
types.example: Am I not playing tennis?; Isn't he playing tennis?; Aren't they playing tennis?

types.formula: I / you / we / they + have + past participle; He / she / it + has + past participle
types.example: I have played tennis; She has played tennis.

types.formula: I / you / we / they + have not (haven't) + past participle; He / she / it + has not (hasn't) + past participle
types.example: I haven't played tennis; He hasn't played tennis.

types.formula: Have + I / you / we / they + past participle?; Has + he / she / it + past participle?
types.example: Have you played tennis?; Has she played tennis?

types.formula: Have + I / you / we / they + not + past participle?; Has + he / she / it + not + past participle?
types.example: Haven't you played tennis?; Hasn't he played tennis?

types.formula: I / you / we / they + have been + main verb + ing; He / she / it + has been + main verb + ing
types.example: I have been playing tennis; She has been playing tennis.

types.formula: I / you / we / they + have not been (haven't been) + main verb + ing; He / she / it + has not been (hasn't been) + main verb + ing
types.example: I haven't been playing tennis; He hasn't been playing tennis.

types.formula: Have + I / you / we / they + been + main verb + ing?; Has + he / she / it + been + main verb + ing?
types.example: Have you been playing tennis?; Has she been playing tennis?

types.formula: Have + I / you / we / they + not been + main verb + ing?; Has + he / she / it + not been + main verb + ing?
types.example: Haven't you been playing tennis?; Hasn't he been playing tennis?

types.formula: Subject + Past Simple form (verb + ed or irregular form)
types.example: I played tennis; She went home.

types.formula: Subject + did not (didn't) + main verb (base form)
types.example: I did not play tennis; He didn't go home.

types.formula: Did + Subject + main verb (base form)?
types.example: Did you play tennis?; Did she go home?

types.formula: Did + Subject + not + main verb (base form)?
types.example: Didn't you play tennis?; Didn't he go home?

types.formula: I / He / She / It + was + main verb + ing; You / We / They + were + main verb + ing
types.example: I was playing tennis; They were playing tennis.

types.formula: I / He / She / It + was not (wasn't) + main verb + ing; You / We / They + were not (weren't) + main verb + ing
types.example: I was not playing tennis; They weren't playing tennis.

types.formula: Was + I / he / she / it + main verb + ing?; Were + you / we / they + main verb + ing?
types.example: Was he playing tennis?; Were they playing tennis?

types.formula: Was + I / he / she / it + not + main verb + ing?; Were + you / we / they + not + main verb + ing?
types.example: Wasn't he playing tennis?; Weren't they playing tennis?

types.formula: Subject + had + past participle
types.example: I had played tennis; She had played tennis.

types.formula: Subject + had not (hadn't) + past participle
types.example: I hadn't played tennis; He hadn't played tennis.

types.formula: Had + Subject + past participle?
types.example: Had you played tennis?; Had she played tennis?

types.formula: Had + Subject + not + past participle?
types.example: Hadn't you played tennis?; Hadn't he played tennis?

types.formula: Subject + had been + main verb + ing
types.example: I had been playing tennis; She had been playing tennis.

types.formula: Subject + had not been (hadn't been) + main verb + ing
types.example: I hadn't been playing tennis; He hadn't been playing tennis.

types.formula: Had + Subject + been + main verb + ing?
types.example: Had you been playing tennis?; Had she been playing tennis?

types.formula: Had + Subject + not been + main verb + ing?
types.example: Hadn't you been playing tennis?; Hadn't he been playing tennis?

types.formula: Subject + will + main verb (base form)
types.example: I will play tennis; She will play tennis.

types.formula: Subject + will not (won't) + main verb (base form)
types.example: I will not play tennis; He won't play tennis.

types.formula: Will + Subject + main verb (base form)?
types.example: Will you play tennis?; Will she play tennis?

types.formula: Will + Subject + not + main verb (base form)?
types.example: Won't you play tennis?; Won't he play tennis?

types.formula: Subject + will be + main verb + ing
types.example: I will be playing tennis.

types.formula: Subject + will not be (won't be) + main verb + ing
types.example: I will not be playing tennis.

types.formula: Will + Subject + be + main verb + ing?
types.example: Will you be playing tennis?

types.formula: Will + Subject + not be + main verb + ing?
types.example: Won't you be playing tennis?

types.formula: Subject + will have + past participle
types.example: I will have played tennis; She will have played tennis.

types.formula: Subject + will not have (won't have) + past participle
types.example: I will not have played tennis; He will not have played tennis.

types.formula: Will + Subject + have + past participle?
types.example: Will you have played tennis?; Will she have played tennis?

types.formula: Will + Subject + not have + past participle?
types.example: Won't you have played tennis?; Won't she have played tennis?

types.formula: Subject + will have been + main verb + ing
types.example: I will have been playing tennis; She will have been playing tennis.

types.formula: Subject + will not have been (won't have been) + main verb + ing
types.example: I will not have been playing tennis; He will not have been playing tennis.

types.formula: Will + Subject + have been + main verb + ing?
types.example: Will you have been playing tennis?; Will she have been playing tennis?

types.formula: Will + Subject + not have been + main verb + ing?
types.example: Won't you have been playing tennis?; Won't he have been playing tennis?
